Patch Set 13: Verified+1

Build Successful 

https://jenkins.openbmc.org/job/ci-repository/57503/ : SUCCESS

Lot of repetition of code. Let's use template format for these tests like below.

Verify Error Log Transmission To Host
    [Documentation]  Verify that error logs are correctly transmitted to the host.
    [Tags]  Verify_Error_Log_Transmission_To_Host
    [Template]  Verify PEL Transmission Field
    
    # error_type            host_state      transmission_state
    informational_error     off             not_sent
    unrecoverabl_error      off             not_sent
    predictive_error        off             not_sent
    informational_error     on              sent
    unrecoverabl_error      on              sent
    predictive_error        on              sent
    
    
Verify PEL Transmission To Host
    [Documentation]  Verify PEL transmission state.
    [Arguments]  ${error_type}  ${host_state}  ${transmission_state}
    
    # Description of argument(s):
    # error_type  type of error log to be injected.
    # ...
    # ...
    
    # Get system in required state.
    If host_state = off
       do Redfish power off
       elif host_state = off
       do Redfish power off

    # Inject required error log.
    If error_type = informational_error
          do BMC Execute Command  ${CMD_INFORMATIONAL_ERROR}
        Else if  error_type = unrecoverabl_error
          do BMC Execute Command  ${unrecoverabl_error}
        else if  error_type == ${predictive_error}
          do BMC Execute Command  ${predictive_error}  
          
    ${pel_records}=  Peltool  -lfh
    ${ids}=  Get Dictionary Keys  ${pel_records}
    ${pel_id}=  Get From List  ${ids}  -1

    # Check transmission details in the error log.
    ${host_transmission}=  Get PEL Field Value  ${pel_id}  User Header  Host Transmission
    Should Be Equal  "${host_transmission}"  "${transmission_state}"

@{mandatory_pel_fields}   Private Header  User Header  Primary SRC
...  Extended User Header  Failing MTMS
Not required to split in two lines. This is under our max 110 limit for line.
Verify PEL Log Transmission To Host
[Documentation]  Inject PEL log of given type and verify its host transmission state.

Make use of else if
    Run Keyword If  '${host_state}' == 'Off'
    ...    Redfish Power Off  stack_mode=skip
    ...  ELSE IF  '${host_state}' == 'On'
    ...    Redfish Power On  stack_mode=skip

you can always use -lfh option to list all the error here. No need to check based on error type.

    ${pel_records}=  Run Keyword  Peltool  -lfh

use the latest keyword for 'Peltool -l'; 'Peltool  -lfh'

get_pel_data_from_bmc()

get_pel_data_from_bmc(include_hidden_pels=False,
                          include_informational_pels=False):

Verify PEL Log Not Offloaded To Host
    [Documentation]  Verify the PEL log of a given type and verify its host transmission state.
    [Tags]  Verify_PEL_Log_Not_Offloaded_To_Host
    [Template]  Verify PEL Transmission To Host

    # error_type            host_state      transmission_state
    informational_error     Off             Not Sent
    unrecoverable_error     Off             Not Sent
    predictive_error        Off             Not Sent
      

Verify PEL Log Offloaded To Host
    [Documentation]  Verify the PEL log of a given type and verify its host transmission state.
    [Tags]  Verify_PEL_Log_Offloaded_To_Host
    # error_type            host_state      transmission_state
    informational_error     On              Sent
    unrecoverable_error     On              Sent
    predictive_error        On              Sent
If transmission is Not Sent  where do we verify ? and why we need sleep for that logic ?

oh yeah. This need to be aligned like below. This would make them split in multiple lines.

@{mandatory_pel_fields}                Private Header  User Header  Primary SRC  
...                                    Extended User Header  Failing MTMS
@{mandatory_Predictive_pel_fileds}     Private Header  User Header  Primary SRC
...                                    Extended User Header  Failing MTMS  User 
...                                    Data
@{Mandatory_Informational_Pel_Fields}  Private Header  User Header  Primary SRC
...                                    Extended User Header  User Data
Verify host transmission state of not offloaded PEL logs.
Verify host transmission state of offloaded PEL logs.

Instead of sleep use wait for sent event.

    # Check host transmission state for the cases where PEL is expected to be 
    ...  offloaded to HOST.
    Run Keyword If  "${transmission_state}" == "sent"
    ...  Wait Until Keyword Succeeds  2 min  10 sec  Is PEL Sent To Host


    # Adding delay before checking host transmission for the cases where PEL is not 
    ...  expected to be offloaded to HOST.
    Run Keyword If  "${transmission_state}" == "Not sent"  Sleep  120s
    


Also add below keyword for above changes to work.
  
Is PEL Sent To Host
    [Documentation]  Check if PEL is sent to host.

    ${pel_records}=  Run Keyword  Peltool  -lfh

    # Check the host transmission details in the PEL log.
    ${host_transmission}=  Get PEL Field Value  ${pel_id}  User Header  Host Transmission
    Should Be Equal  "${host_transmission}"  "sent"

Run Keyword If  "${expected_transmission_state}" == "Not sent"
    ...  Run Keywords  Sleep  120s  AND
    ...  Check If PEL Transmission State Is Expected  not send
